title: Pablo Chacón
text:
Julio Pablo Chacón (born May 22, 1975) is an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. Nicknamed "El Relámpago", Chacon won a <a href="Olympic%20medalists%20in%20boxing">Featherweight Bronze medal</a> at the <a href="1996%20Summer%20Olympics">1996 Summer Olympics</a>. He was born in <a href="Las%20Heras%2C%20Mendoza">Las Heras, Mendoza</a>.
Professional career.
Chacon began his professional career in 1996 and went on to become WBO Featherweight champion. Chacon won his first 36 fights, setting up a fight with WBA Featherweight Title holder <a href="Freddie%20Norwood">Freddie Norwood</a> in 2000. Norwood dropped Chacon in the 3rd and won a unanimous decision. In 2001, Chacon defeated <a href="Istv%C3%A1n%20Kov%C3%A1cs%20%28boxer%29">Istvan Kovacs</a> by TKO to win the WBO Featherweight title. He defended his title four times, including a victory over Victor Polo, prior to losing his title in 2002 to interim champ <a href="Scott%20Harrison%20%28boxer%29">Scott Harrison</a>. He later moved up a weight class and challenged <a href="Mike%20Anchondo">Mike Anchondo</a> for the Vacant WBO Super Featherweight Title, but lost a decision. In 2010 he won the <a href="Konex%20Award">Konex Award</a> Merit Diploma as one of the five best boxers of the last decade in Argentina.
